content.content: MIP4c2-SP22: MIP41 Facilitator Offboarding Amendment  Preamble MIP4c2-SP#: 22 MIP to be amended: MIP41 Author(s): Sam MacPherson (@hexonaut) Contributors: Tags: MIP41, facilitator Status: Withdrawn Date Proposed: 2022-07-03 Date Ratified: N/A Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip4c2-sp22-mip41-facilitator-offboarding-amendment/16297   Specification  Motivation Currently it is trivial to create offboarding proposals under an account with zero reputation attached. In theory a new account can be created and apart to post throttling this individual (or bot) could create offboardings for every single core unit all of which have to go to vote. It is my opinion that due to the severity of this action we should have a minimal level of Sybil protection. Spam submissions haven’t happened yet, but they likely will especially as conflicts in the DAO heat up under bear market conditions. I would like to get ahead of this by proposing a modest threshold to submit a facilitator offboarding requiring posting 1 MKR. If the proposal succeeds then the user gets their MKR back, if it fails the MKR is forfeit. This will result in the user having to post financial stake to begin the offboarding process. The stake is low enough that if truly desired offboardings are there it is not hard to surmount and likely the user will get their MKR back. On the other hand this will prevent spam submissions from clogging up the governance process.  Amended MIPs and Components This MIP4c2 subproposal revises MIP41 as well as related subcomponents MIP41c5.  Amendment Pull Request   github.com/makerdao/mips         Add 1 MKR requirement for Facilitator Offboarding   makerdao:master ← hexonaut:MIP41-modification            opened 08:13PM - 03 Jul 22 UTC               hexonaut             +14 -0       This makes the voluntary offboarding language more clear, adds a 1 MKR requireme…nt for offboarding along with a bypass via Signal Request.  https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip4c2-spxx-mip41-facilitator-offboarding-amendment/16297        Relevant Information

content.content: My first reaction echos @Doo_StableLab. This seems like a solution to a problem that doesn’t exist yet. It also goes against the notion that we evaluate proposals based on merit because it gates proposals behind the ability to put 1MKR at risk. Maintaining obligations is one of my core values and I don’t want us to wantonly off board neither CUs nor facilitators. Nor do I want governance to get jammed by requests for off-boarding because lone individuals want to settle scores. To try to reconcile those differences I suggest an additional clause to this proposal. “The requirement of 1 MKR is waived if the suggestion has passed a signal request prior to being introduced as an MIP.”

content.content: hexonaut:  Well this is a good question. If a bunch of well-written, hand crafted MIPs came in to offboard every core unit all at once, would @GovAlpha-Core-Unit block this? My guess is no, but I’ll let them answer.   To confirm, if properly submitted (following Request for Comments rules on timing, in the correct format that our MIP editor would assist with etc.) we would allow the proposals to enter the voting cycle. MIPs are the rules MKR holders vote in for us to enforce, so unless there’s something passed making the action forbidden it’s our duty to allow the community to vote on it, absent a severe danger to the protocol in promoting such a vote. It is often a difficult situation for CUs that have been the subject of an offboarding proposal, but we try to emphasize that it is the merit of the argument that should be focused on. The identity of the person seeking to offboard is pretty irrelevant, as if they have known supporters (people that will vote with their name in favor of an offboarding proposal) the proposal could just be forked and run by one of the supporting delegates.  Perhaps this is a problem (lower barrier to demand CUs justify their existence than the effort it takes for CUs to defend themselves from malicious offboarding), and this amendment addresses  part of that cost. Ultimately that’s what we should be discussing, what problem does this address and is it the best solution to that problem. Appreciate the initiative to start that discussion with this proposal @hexonaut and happy to answer any other Governance interpretation questions.

content.content: Yes that is the thinking.     Patrick_J:  If so, it seems a little strange to vote twice on the same proposal.   It seems weird if you look at it abstractly, but I can provide concrete example of how this will help with reference to the current Events offboarding:  Status Quo Anyone can initiate an offboarding proposal which has very real consequences for long term planning. The Events team is actively scouting a venue for DevCon, and if the offboarding is successful then they will only be able to cover 75% of the budget for that event. Downpayments are required months in advance. Should they continue scouting the venue? This is unclear because we do not know the likelyhood of the offboarding proceeding until mid-August. The observation is it requires barely any effort to essentially cause effects worth $60k+.  Fast-fail Signal Request By including a faster temperature check we get a much stronger likelyhood indicator in a 2 week span vs the 2 month AND the CUs still can defend themselves. If the SR passes then the CU should start preparing for offboarding by cancelling long term plans. If it fails well we know this quickly and can continue working.
